intro: Siphocampylus furax, commonly known as the narrowleaf siphocampylus, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in woodland or meadow habitats. The plant features finely divided, linear leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It is native to regions of Europe and western Asia, where it thrives in temperate climates. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species.
